settings.text: To be sustainable, we must recognize that our environment is limited in resources. To protect the Earth, our planet, humanity, and all life, it is vital that we use the environment and any of its resources rationally.

settings.title: Envionmental
settings.text: To preserve our environment for future generations, we must take environmental responsibility very seriously. Every individual has a responsibility to consider their impact on the environment and minimize their damage to the planet. Modern day necessities and luxuries has an inverse effect on the environment, whether we think about it or not. Being responsible for our environment means being aware of our actions and not taking or doing more than we have to!

settings.title: Social
settings.text: Unless we make a decision to protect the environment, it is impossible to make a choice between individual and collective responsibility. One way to pursue social learning is to encourage everyone to reduce their environmental impact. When we engage in such activities, we should keep our well-being and the planet's well-being in mind. When our values become habits, they reinforce and influence how we understand and appreciate the world.

settings.title: Economic
settings.text: In the face of extreme income inequality, we should avoid quick fixes. Instead, we should look for ways to understand better cultural differences, values, and perceptions to help us transition to a more sustainable global economy. We must develop equitable solutions and practices to benefit business and the economy without harming society, the environment, or culture.

settings.title: Every environmental challenge is a human one

settings.text:
Taking care of our planet also means caring for all its inhabitants and people. Leah Thomas' words and ideas resonate with us, and we embrace intersectional environmentalism as well. In this, we believe in “an inclusive version of environmentalism that advocates for protecting people and the planet.” In order to achieve fair and empowering representation, sustainability cannot come from privileged positions, and all those involved must spread the culture of historically excluded or marginalized groups. In fact, climate change and environmental issues have more adversely affected the BIPOC community, the LGBTQIA+ community, the disabled community, women, and those facing abject poverty.

We work to ensure that a greener future is possible for all people, not just those who can afford it based on their positions or advantages. As we lift each other and our communities, we will also be reshaping the landscape for the future and for environmentalism that is more open, equal, and inclusive!

settings.title: Optimize
settings.text: In order to optimize, we take into account our actions and ways of living and seek to change them for the most sustainable results. Sustainable living is a journey filled with imperfections, but the ultimate goal is to live while reducing our impact on the environment.

settings.title: transform
settings.text: To better ourselves and our planet, we must innovate and change. We consciously become more attuned to sustainable needs by tracking our growth and reviewing what is working and what isn't.

settings.title: Join us on the #Root2Renew, as even the smallest step can make a difference!
